map.onboarding_body: Every six months, you will be asked to complete *one week* of cognitive tests. During the week, you will be reminded *4 times a day* to complete tests within the app. You may be in the study for as long as *5 years* (10 weeks of testing).

map.DIAN_Inv_about_body: The Ambulatory Research in Cognition (ARC) app was designed by the Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory (CTRLab) in the Department of Neurology at Washington University in St. Louis for participants enrolled in the Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer Network (DIAN) studies. The ARC app assesses cognition using frequently administered but brief cognitive tests. This app is intended for use only by participants enrolled in DIAN studies.
map.HASD_about_body: The Ambulatory Research in Cognition (ARC) app was designed by the Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory in the Department of Neurology at Washington University in St. Louis for participants enrolled in the Memory and Aging Project. The ARC app assesses cognition using frequently administered but brief cognitive tests. This app is intended for use only by participants enrolled in the Memory and Aging Project studies.
map.faq_subpage_subheader: Tap a question to see the answer.
map.faq_testing_q1: How long do I have to take tests?
map.faq_testing_q2: Do I have to take the test as soon as I get the notification?
map.faq_testing_q3: What if I miss some tests?
map.faq_testing_q4: How do I know when I have finished the test?
map.faq_testing_q5: How do I know when the next week of testing starts?
map.faq_testing_q6: What should I do if I keep getting the message, "No tests available at this time"?
map.faq_testing_q7: Can I change my testing schedule?
map.faq_testing_q8: Can I see how I'm doing on the tests?
map.faq_testing_q9: Can I let my friend/grandchild/spouse take some of the tests?
map.faq_testing_q10: I'm not sure I'm doing the test correctly. Can I practice?
map.faq_testing_a1: You will get notifications for tests four times per day for one week, then no tests for the next *6* months. The individual tests take approximately 3 to 5 minutes to complete. A new week of tests will start every six months for as long as you are in the study.
map.faq_testing_a2: You will have up to two hours from the time you get the notification to take the test. After two hours, you will no longer be able to complete that test session.
map.faq_testing_a3: While we want you to complete as many tests as possible, we realize that you may lead a very busy life! It's ok to miss a few tests, but please try to complete as many as possible - they only take 3-5 minutes each. Also, when you get a notification, you have two hours to take the test; you do not have to drop everything and take the test immediately.
map.faq_testing_a4: At the end of the tests, you will be asked to answer whether or not you were interrupted during any of the tests. Once you have answered this question, you will then sign your initials and press "Submit". This will mark the end of the test.
map.faq_testing_a5: If you are not currently in a testing cycle, the app home page will indicate the dates of your next week of testing. Additionally, you will get reminder notifications one month, one week, and one day out from each testing cycle. You will have the option to adjust the dates of your testing cycle by one week.
map.faq_testing_a6:
If you open the app and see "There are no tests to take right now", it is possible that you have missed the 2-hour window for your test session. You will receive a notification when it is time to take your next test. That test will be available for 2-hours following the notification. 

If you see the message "There are no tests to take right now" and feel that this is in error, please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_testing_a7:
You can change the time of day you are available to take your tests at any point. To change the time of day you are available for testing, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *time of day* I am available for testing." 

Additionally, you can change the dates of an upcoming testing cycle when you have finished your current testing cycle. To change the dates of your next testing cycle, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *dates* of my next *testing cycle*."
map.faq_testing_a8: You will not be able to see the results of the tests. The data collected during the tests is for research purposes only and is not intended to make a diagnosis or treat a condition. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any concerns.
map.faq_testing_a9: We ask that you complete the tests yourself, as part of your participation in the study. Following each test, you will be asked to sign your initials to verify that you were the one who completed the test.
map.faq_testing_a10: You can review the tutorials at any time as a way to "practice" taking the tests. To do this, choose "View a Tutorial" on the instruction screen of a test.
map.faq_tech_q1: What do I do if I change phones?
map.faq_tech_q2: The app isn't working. What should I do?
map.faq_tech_q4: How do I check if notifications are set up correctly?
map.faq_tech_q5: How do I resolve two-step verification issues?
map.faq_tech_q6: What is the Test Scheduler Service?
map.faq_tech_q7: Why am I getting a message telling me to close other apps?
map.faq_tech_a1: You will need to re-install the app if you change to a different phone. Please contact your study coordinator to provide you with an updated password for your new device.
map.faq_tech_a2: Contact your study coordinator. If s/he cannot get the app to work in the moment, s/he will get back to you ASAP with a solution.
map.faq_tech_a3: We collect your initials via the signature page as well as the results of your neurocognitive tests. The data will save to you phone until there is a connection. Once there is a connection, your data will be securely transferred directly from the mobile app to the study database using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) with encryption.
map.faq_tech_a4: Your notifications are set up when you define your availability. You will receive 4 testing notifications per day during your availability window. You can change this window via Resources in the app navigation bar.
map.faq_tech_a5: If you are having issues with two-step verification, the first step is to verify the phone digits on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. These two digits should be the same as the last two digits of your phone number. If these digits do not match your phone number, please contact your study coordinator. If these digits do match your phone number, the next step is to send a new code to your phone number. You can do this by clicking "Didn't receive code?" on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. If the new code does not work (or you do not receive a code), please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_tech_a6:
During testing weeks, you may see a notification that the Test Scheduler Service is running. This service allows us to send you testing notifications at specific times. Since this is required for the study, it cannot be disabled.

The Test Scheduler Service will only run during testing weeks and will not significantly impact the battery life of your phone.
map.faq_tech_a7: You may see this message appear during a test session: “Please close other apps to improve performance.” This may mean your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as DIAN. For the best performance, please close other apps before starting a test session.
map.faq_earnings_q4: What's the difference between "this week" and "study total"?
map.faq_earnings_a1: You can earn up to $32 per 7-day testing cycle for as long as you are in the study. You earn $0.50 for each test you complete (up to $14 per cycle). You also can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests.
map.faq_earnings_a2: Your payment will be processed immediately upon completion of a testing cycle. It may take several business days for your payment to be processed. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any questions about when you will receive your payment.
map.faq_earnings_a3: You will be paid via an electronic gift card or check.
map.faq_earnings_a4: This week refers to the amount of money you have earned during the current testing cycle. "Study total" refers to the cumulative amount of money you have earned from all testing cycles, including the current one.
map.faq_earnings_a5: Bonus goals are money that can be earned above and beyond the $0.50 earned per completed test session. During each testing cycle, you can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests. You are able to earn money for all three bonus goals.

map.grids_tutorial_vb_step1:
This test has three parts.

In the first part, you will see 3 items placed in a grid of boxes. You will be asked to *remember each item and its location on the grid*. The goal is to try and remember where each item is placed on the grid. You will have 3 seconds to study the grid.

map.DIAN_Inv_contact_email1: For any questions, please contact your Study Coordinator.
map.DIAN_Inv_about_body: The Ambulatory Research in Cognition (ARC) app was designed by the Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory (CTRLab) in the Department of Neurology at Washington University in St. Louis for participants enrolled in the Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer Network (DIAN) studies. The ARC app assesses cognition using frequently administered but brief cognitive tests. This app is intended for use only by participants enrolled in DIAN studies.
map.faq_subpage_subheader: Tap a question to see the answer.
map.faq_testing_q1: How long do I have to take tests?
map.faq_testing_q2: Do I have to take the test as soon as I get the notification?
map.faq_testing_q3: What if I miss some tests?
map.faq_testing_q4: How do I know when I have finished the test?
map.faq_testing_q5: How do I know when the next week of testing starts?
map.faq_testing_q6: What should I do if I keep getting the message, "No tests available at this time"?
map.faq_testing_q7: Can I change my testing schedule?
map.faq_testing_q8: Can I see how I'm doing on the tests?
map.faq_testing_q9: Can I let my friend/grandchild/spouse take some of the tests?
map.faq_testing_q10: I'm not sure I'm doing the test correctly. Can I practice?
map.faq_testing_a1: You will get notifications for tests four times per day for one week, then no tests for the next *6* months. The individual tests take approximately 3 to 5 minutes to complete. A new week of tests will start every six months for as long as you are in the study.
map.faq_testing_a2: You will have up to two hours from the time you get the notification to take the test. After two hours, you will no longer be able to complete that test session.
map.faq_testing_a3: While we want you to complete as many tests as possible, we realize that you may lead a very busy life! It's ok to miss a few tests, but please try to complete as many as possible - they only take 3-5 minutes each. Also, when you get a notification, you have two hours to take the test; you do not have to drop everything and take the test immediately.
map.faq_testing_a4: At the end of the tests, you will be asked to answer whether or not you were interrupted during any of the tests. Once you have answered this question, you will then sign your initials and press "Submit". This will mark the end of the test.
map.faq_testing_a5: If you are not currently in a testing cycle, the app home page will indicate the dates of your next week of testing. Additionally, you will get reminder notifications one month, one week, and one day out from each testing cycle. You will have the option to adjust the dates of your testing cycle by one week.
map.faq_testing_a6:
If you open the app and see "There are no tests to take right now", it is possible that you have missed the 2-hour window for your test session. You will receive a notification when it is time to take your next test. That test will be available for 2-hours following the notification. 

If you see the message "There are no tests to take right now" and feel that this is in error, please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_testing_a7:
You can change the time of day you are available to take your tests at any point. To change the time of day you are available for testing, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *time of day* I am available for testing." 

Additionally, you can change the dates of an upcoming testing cycle when you have finished your current testing cycle. To change the dates of your next testing cycle, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *dates* of my next *testing cycle*."
map.faq_testing_a8: You will not be able to see the results of the tests. The data collected during the tests is for research purposes only and is not intended to make a diagnosis or treat a condition. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any concerns.
map.faq_testing_a9: We ask that you complete the tests yourself, as part of your participation in the study. Following each test, you will be asked to sign your initials to verify that you were the one who completed the test.
map.faq_testing_a10: You can review the tutorials at any time as a way to "practice" taking the tests. To do this, choose "View a Tutorial" on the instruction screen of a test.
map.faq_tech_q1: What do I do if I change phones?
map.faq_tech_q2: The app isn't working. What should I do?
map.faq_tech_q4: How do I check if notifications are set up correctly?
map.faq_tech_q5: How do I resolve two-step verification issues?
map.faq_tech_q6: What is the Test Scheduler Service?
map.faq_tech_q7: Why am I getting a message telling me to close other apps?
map.faq_tech_a1: You will need to re-install the app if you change to a different phone. Please contact your study coordinator to provide you with an updated password for your new device.
map.faq_tech_a2: Contact your study coordinator. If s/he cannot get the app to work in the moment, s/he will get back to you ASAP with a solution.
map.faq_tech_a3: We collect your initials via the signature page as well as the results of your neurocognitive tests. The data will save to you phone until there is a connection. Once there is a connection, your data will be securely transferred directly from the mobile app to the study database using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) with encryption.
map.faq_tech_a4: Your notifications are set up when you define your availability. You will receive 4 testing notifications per day during your availability window. You can change this window via Resources in the app navigation bar.
map.faq_tech_a5: If you are having issues with two-step verification, the first step is to verify the phone digits on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. These two digits should be the same as the last two digits of your phone number. If these digits do not match your phone number, please contact your study coordinator. If these digits do match your phone number, the next step is to send a new code to your phone number. You can do this by clicking "Didn't receive code?" on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. If the new code does not work (or you do not receive a code), please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_tech_a6:
During testing weeks, you may see a notification that the Test Scheduler Service is running. This service allows us to send you testing notifications at specific times. Since this is required for the study, it cannot be disabled.

The Test Scheduler Service will only run during testing weeks and will not significantly impact the battery life of your phone.
map.faq_tech_a7: You may see this message appear during a test session: “Please close other apps to improve performance.” This may mean your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as DIAN. For the best performance, please close other apps before starting a test session.
map.faq_earnings_q4: What's the difference between "this week" and "study total"?
map.faq_earnings_a1: You can earn up to $32 per 7-day testing cycle for as long as you are in the study. You earn $0.50 for each test you complete (up to $14 per cycle). You also can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests.
map.faq_earnings_a2: Your payment will be processed immediately upon completion of a testing cycle. It may take several business days for your payment to be processed. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any questions about when you will receive your payment.
map.faq_earnings_a3: You will be paid via an electronic gift card or check.
map.faq_earnings_a4: This week refers to the amount of money you have earned during the current testing cycle. "Study total" refers to the cumulative amount of money you have earned from all testing cycles, including the current one.
map.faq_earnings_a5: Bonus goals are money that can be earned above and beyond the $0.50 earned per completed test session. During each testing cycle, you can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests. You are able to earn money for all three bonus goals.
map.progress_studydisclaimer: End date depends upon your testing schedule.
map.earnings_body0:

You will receive a *Gift Card or check* for the earned amount after each week of testing.

map.earnings_2aday_body: Complete *at least 2* test sessions every day of the week to earn *{AMOUNT}*.

Answer questions in regard to your sleep and wake behavior on work and work-free days. 

^Please estimate an average of your normal sleep behavior over the past 6 weeks when you were able to follow your usual routines.^

Please answer all of the following questions even if you do not work or do not work 7 days/week.

map.chronotype_workfree_wake: On *work-free days* when I don't use an alarm clock, I normally *wake up* at:

map.chronotype_disclaim2: This is NOT when you get out of bed.
map.wakesurvey_body: The following questions will ask you about sleep specific to last night and waking this morning.
map.wake_q1: What time did you get in bed last night?
map.wake_q2: How long did it take you to fall asleep last night?
map.wake_q3a: How many times did you wake for 5 minutes or longer?
map.wake_q4: What time did you wake up this morning?
map.wake_q5: What time did you get out of bed this morning?
map.wake_q6: How would you rate the quality of your sleep?

map.context_q1: Who is with you right now?
map.context_q3: How would you rate *your overall mood* right now?
map.context_q4: How would you rate *how you feel* right now?
map.context_q5: In the past 5 minutes, what were you mostly doing?

map.prices_body:
Please decide if the displayed price is a good bargain for that item. 

The pair will only remain on the screen for a short time, so please make your decision quickly and pay close attention.
map.prices_overlay: You will now see an item and two prices. Please select the price that matches the item from the previous section.
map.symbols_body:
You will see three pairs of symbols at the top of the screen and two pairs at the bottom. 

As quickly as you can, tap the pair at the bottom of the screen that matches one of the pairs at the top.
map.symbols_match: Which pair below matches one of the pairs on the top?
map.grids_body: Study the grid and try to remember the location of the three items.
map.grids_overlay1: Try to remember the location of the items
map.grids_overlay3: Next: Tap on the locations of the items.
map.grids_subheader_boxes: Tap the boxes where the items were located in part one.
map.grids_vb_body: In this activity, you will study 3 items placed on a grid. Then, you will be asked to remember each item and its location on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_step1:
This test has three parts.

In the first part, you will see 3 items placed in a grid of boxes. You will be asked to *remember each item and its location on the grid*. The goal is to try and remember where each item is placed on the grid. You will have 3 seconds to study the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place:
Place each item in its location
from part one.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place_other: Great! Now, place the other two items on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_change_mind: Change your mind? Select a different item to replace, or tap *Remove Item* to clear.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech1:
*Nice work!*
It looks like you didn't need any help with placement, but we want to make sure we still teach you how to swap and remove items before you move onto the actual test.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech2: If you change your mind after placing an item, you can move it. Let's try it.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech3: Great! If you would like to clear a box with an item, first tap that box...
map.grids_tutorial_vb_select: Select the item that was here.
map.progress_baseline_notice: Thanks for completing the practice session today! *Your testing week officially begins tomorrow.*
map.progress_practice_body2: Starting tomorrow, *you'll earn money* for each session you complete!
map.progress_cycleorstudycomplete_body: Thank you for contributing to our research. Your time and hard work are truly valuable.

map.popup_tutorial_view: Tap here to view a tutorial
map.popup_tutorial_quit: Tap here to quit the tutorial.
map.popup_tutorial_price_intro: The Prices test has two parts. *First, evaluate the price.*
map.popup_tutorial_choose1:
*What do you think?*
Choose the answer that makes sense to you.
map.popup_tutorial_greatchoice2:
*Another great choice!* 
Let's proceed to part two.
map.popup_tutorial_recall:
*What do you think?* 
Try your best to recall the price from part one.
map.popup_tutorial_choose2:
*What do you think?* 
Choose the price that you saw in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_complete:
*Congratulations on completing the tutorial!*
If you'd like to take it again, you can always tap here.
map.popup_tutorial_tile:
*This is a tile.* 
Each tile includes a pair of symbols.
map.popup_tutorial_tilestop: You will see *three tiles* on the top of the screen...
map.popup_tutorial_middle_instructions: Tap the *bottom tile that matches* a tile on the top.
map.popup_tutorial_greatjob:
*Great job!* 
Let's try a couple more for practice.
map.popup_tutorial_grid_recall: In this three part test, you'll be asked to *recall the location* of these items.
map.popup_tutorial_rememberbox: The items will be placed in a grid of boxes. *Remember which box each item is in*. You will have 3 seconds.
map.popup_tutorial_tapf2:
*Perfect!* 
Now: *Tap all the F's* you can see as quickly as you can. You will have 8 seconds.
map.popup_tutorial_tapf3:
*Nice work!*
Don't worry if you didn't find them all.
map.popup_tutorial_tapsymbol: Now, tap the cell phone to place it in the selected box.
map.popup_tutorial_tapsymbol2: Then, tap the cell phone button to place it in the new box.
map.popup_tutorial_selectbox: In the final part of the test, you will *select the three boxes* where these items were located in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_selectboxV2: In part three, place each item in its location from part one.
map.popup_tutorial_boxhint: *Hint:* One item was located in this box. Tap here.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox: Now tap on the locations of the other two items.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox2: Tap on the locations of the other two items.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox3: Tap on the location of the final item.
map.popup_tutorial_subheader: Tap the boxes where the items were located in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_cellbox: *Hint:* The cell phone was located here. Tap this box.

Check here to see if it's time to take a test.
map.popup_tab_progress:

See where you are in the testing week.

map.popup_tab_resources:

map.popup_nicejob:
*Nice job on the tests!*

map.battery_optimization_overview:
Your phone has a setting to help preserve your battery life, and it is called a “battery optimization” setting.

The {APP_NAME} app will have minimal impact on the battery life of your phone. It is recommended that you turn off the battery optimization setting for the {APP_NAME} app. Doing so will help make sure you receive test notifications on time.

map.onboarding_body: Every six months, you will be asked to complete *one week* of cognitive tests. During the week, you will be reminded *4 times a day* to complete tests within the app. You may be in the study for as long as *5 years* (10 weeks of testing).

It's ok to miss a few tests, but please try to complete as many as possible - they only take 3-5 minutes each. Also, when you get a notification, you have two hours to take the test; you do not have to drop everything and take the test immediately.
map.faq_testing_a4: At the end of the tests, you will be asked to answer whether or not you were interrupted during any of the tests. Once you have answered this question, you will then sign your initials and press "Submit". This will mark the end of the test.
map.faq_testing_a5: If you are not currently in a testing cycle, the app home page will indicate the dates of your next week of testing. Additionally, you will get reminder notifications one month, one week, and one day out from each testing cycle. You will have the option to adjust the dates of your testing cycle by one week.
map.faq_testing_a6:
If you open the app and see "There are no tests to take right now", it is possible that you have missed the 2-hour window for your test session. You will receive a notification when it is time to take your next test. That test will be available for 2-hours following the notification. 

If you see the message "There are no tests to take right now" and feel that this is in error, please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_testing_a7:
You can change the time of day you are available to take your tests at any point. To change the time of day you are available for testing, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *time of day* I am available for testing." 

Additionally, you can change the dates of an upcoming testing cycle when you have finished your current testing cycle. To change the dates of your next testing cycle, choose "Resources" from the navigation bar at the bottom of the app screen, then "Change My Availability", and finally "I would like to change the *dates* of my next *testing cycle*."
map.faq_testing_a8: You will not be able to see the results of the tests. The data collected during the tests is for research purposes only and is not intended to make a diagnosis or treat a condition. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any concerns.
map.faq_testing_a9: We ask that you complete the tests yourself, as part of your participation in the study. Following each test, you will be asked to sign your initials to verify that you were the one who completed the test.
map.faq_testing_a10: You can review the tutorials at any time as a way to "practice" taking the tests. To do this, choose "View a Tutorial" on the instruction screen of a test.
map.faq_tech_q1: What do I do if I change phones?
map.faq_tech_q2: The app isn't working. What should I do?
map.faq_tech_q4: How do I check if notifications are set up correctly?
map.faq_tech_q5: How do I resolve two-step verification issues?
map.faq_tech_q6: What is the Test Scheduler Service?
map.faq_tech_q7: Why am I getting a message telling me to close other apps?
map.faq_tech_a1: You will need to re-install the app if you change to a different phone. Please contact your study coordinator to provide you with an updated password for your new device.
map.faq_tech_a2: Contact your study coordinator. If s/he cannot get the app to work in the moment, s/he will get back to you ASAP with a solution.
map.faq_tech_a3: We collect your initials via the signature page as well as the results of your neurocognitive tests. The data will save to you phone until there is a connection. Once there is a connection, your data will be securely transferred directly from the mobile app to the study database using Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) with encryption.
map.faq_tech_a4: Your notifications are set up when you define your availability. You will receive 4 testing notifications per day during your availability window. You can change this window via Resources in the app navigation bar.
map.faq_tech_a5: If you are having issues with two-step verification, the first step is to verify the phone digits on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. These two digits should be the same as the last two digits of your phone number. If these digits do not match your phone number, please contact your study coordinator. If these digits do match your phone number, the next step is to send a new code to your phone number. You can do this by clicking "Didn't receive code?" on the page that asks you to enter a login verification code. If the new code does not work (or you do not receive a code), please contact your study coordinator.
map.faq_tech_a6:
During testing weeks, you may see a notification that the Test Scheduler Service is running. This service allows us to send you testing notifications at specific times. Since this is required for the study, it cannot be disabled.

The Test Scheduler Service will only run during testing weeks and will not significantly impact the battery life of your phone.
map.faq_tech_a7: You may see this message appear during a test session: “Please close other apps to improve performance.” This may mean your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as DIAN. For the best performance, please close other apps before starting a test session.
map.faq_earnings_q4: What's the difference between "this week" and "study total"?
map.faq_earnings_a1: You can earn up to $32 per 7-day testing cycle for as long as you are in the study. You earn $0.50 for each test you complete (up to $14 per cycle). You also can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests.
map.faq_earnings_a2: Your payment will be processed immediately upon completion of a testing cycle. It may take several business days for your payment to be processed. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any questions about when you will receive your payment.
map.faq_earnings_a3: You will be paid via an electronic gift card or check.
map.faq_earnings_a4: This week refers to the amount of money you have earned during the current testing cycle. "Study total" refers to the cumulative amount of money you have earned from all testing cycles, including the current one.
map.faq_earnings_a5: Bonus goals are money that can be earned above and beyond the $0.50 earned per completed test session. During each testing cycle, you can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests. You are able to earn money for all three bonus goals.
map.progress_studydisclaimer: End date depends upon your testing schedule.
map.earnings_body0:
*Starting tomorrow*, you will earn small amounts of money for completing test sessions.

You will receive a *Gift Card or check* for the earned amount after each week of testing.
map.earnings_body1: You will receive a *Gift Card or check* for the earned amount after each week of testing.
map.earnings_bonus_body: Complete the following testing goals to *earn bonuses*.
map.earnings_4of4_body: Complete *all 4* test sessions for the day to earn *{AMOUNT}*.
map.earnings_2aday_body: Complete *at least 2* test sessions every day of the week to earn *{AMOUNT}*.
map.chronotype_body1:
Answer questions in regard to your sleep and wake behavior on work and work-free days. 

^Please estimate an average of your normal sleep behavior over the past 6 weeks when you were able to follow your usual routines.^
map.chronotype_q1: I have been a shift- or night-worker in the past three months.
map.chronotype_body2:
Please answer all of the following questions even if you do not work or do not work 7 days/week. 

^Please don't forget to indicate AM or PM.^
map.chronotype_workfree_sleep: On *work-free days* when I don't use an alarm clock, I normally *fall asleep* at:
map.chronotype_workfree_wake: On *work-free days* when I don't use an alarm clock, I normally *wake up* at:
map.chronotype_disclaim1: This is NOT when you go to bed.
map.chronotype_disclaim2: This is NOT when you get out of bed.
map.wakesurvey_body: The following questions will ask you about sleep specific to last night and waking this morning.
map.wake_q1: What time did you get in bed last night?
map.wake_q2: How long did it take you to fall asleep last night?
map.wake_q3a: How many times did you wake for 5 minutes or longer?
map.wake_q4: What time did you wake up this morning?
map.wake_q5: What time did you get out of bed this morning?
map.wake_q6: How would you rate the quality of your sleep?
map.context_body: These questions will briefly ask you about what is happening around you right now in this moment.
map.context_q1: Who is with you right now?
map.context_q3: How would you rate *your overall mood* right now?
map.context_q4: How would you rate *how you feel* right now?
map.context_q5: In the past 5 minutes, what were you mostly doing?
map.testing_intro_header: You will now complete 3 quick tests
map.testing_intro_body: ^You cannot pause a test once it has been started. You cannot go back to the previous screen.^
map.testing_interrupted_body: Were you interrupted or did you have to stop while taking any of these tests?
map.testing_id_header: Please sign your initials on the line below.
map.testing_id_body: By signing my initials on the line below, I attest that I completed these tests.
map.prices_body:
Please decide if the displayed price is a good bargain for that item. 

The pair will only remain on the screen for a short time, so please make your decision quickly and pay close attention.
map.prices_overlay: You will now see an item and two prices. Please select the price that matches the item from the previous section.
map.symbols_body:
You will see three pairs of symbols at the top of the screen and two pairs at the bottom. 

As quickly as you can, tap the pair at the bottom of the screen that matches one of the pairs at the top.
map.symbols_match: Which pair below matches one of the pairs on the top?
map.grids_body: Study the grid and try to remember the location of the three items.
map.grids_overlay1: Try to remember the location of the items
map.grids_overlay3: Next: Tap on the locations of the items.
map.grids_subheader_boxes: Tap the boxes where the items were located in part one.
map.grids_vb_body: In this activity, you will study 3 items placed on a grid. Then, you will be asked to remember each item and its location on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_step1:
This test has three parts.

In the first part, you will see 3 items placed in a grid of boxes. You will be asked to *remember each item and its location on the grid*. The goal is to try and remember where each item is placed on the grid. You will have 3 seconds to study the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place:
Place each item in its location
from part one.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place_other: Great! Now, place the other two items on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_change_mind: Change your mind? Select a different item to replace, or tap *Remove Item* to clear.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech1:
*Nice work!*
It looks like you didn't need any help with placement, but we want to make sure we still teach you how to swap and remove items before you move onto the actual test.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech2: If you change your mind after placing an item, you can move it. Let's try it.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech3: Great! If you would like to clear a box with an item, first tap that box...
map.grids_tutorial_vb_select: Select the item that was here.
map.progress_baseline_notice: Thanks for completing the practice session today! *Your testing week officially begins tomorrow.*
map.progress_practice_body2: Starting tomorrow, *you'll earn money* for each session you complete!
map.progress_cycleorstudycomplete_body: Thank you for contributing to our research. Your time and hard work are truly valuable.
map.overlay_nextcycle:
*Your next testing cycle will be {DATE1} through {DATE2}.*

Please confirm these testing dates or adjust your schedule.
map.progress_studytotals_body: Your study coordinator will be in touch shortly with further instructions. In the meantime, check out all you accomplished:
map.progress_endoftest_syncing: Just a moment while we update your earnings...
map.progress_endoftest_nosync: It's taking longer than usual to sync. Check the Earnings tab later to see your updated totals.
map.login_error2: This ARC ID is already enrolled on another device.
map.login_error3: Sorry, our app is currently experiencing issues. Please try again later.
map.popup_tutorial_view: Tap here to view a tutorial
map.popup_tutorial_quit: Tap here to quit the tutorial.
map.popup_tutorial_price_intro: The Prices test has two parts. *First, evaluate the price.*
map.popup_tutorial_choose1:
*What do you think?*
Choose the answer that makes sense to you.
map.popup_tutorial_greatchoice2:
*Another great choice!* 
Let's proceed to part two.
map.popup_tutorial_recall:
*What do you think?* 
Try your best to recall the price from part one.
map.popup_tutorial_choose2:
*What do you think?* 
Choose the price that you saw in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_complete:
*Congratulations on completing the tutorial!*
If you'd like to take it again, you can always tap here.
map.popup_tutorial_tile:
*This is a tile.* 
Each tile includes a pair of symbols.
map.popup_tutorial_tilestop: You will see *three tiles* on the top of the screen...
map.popup_tutorial_middle_instructions: Tap the *bottom tile that matches* a tile on the top.
map.popup_tutorial_greatjob:
*Great job!* 
Let's try a couple more for practice.
map.popup_tutorial_grid_recall: In this three part test, you'll be asked to *recall the location* of these items.
map.popup_tutorial_rememberbox: The items will be placed in a grid of boxes. *Remember which box each item is in*. You will have 3 seconds.
map.popup_tutorial_tapf2:
*Perfect!* 
Now: *Tap all the F's* you can see as quickly as you can. You will have 8 seconds.
map.popup_tutorial_tapf3:
*Nice work!*
Don't worry if you didn't find them all.
map.popup_tutorial_tapsymbol: Now, tap the cell phone to place it in the selected box.
map.popup_tutorial_tapsymbol2: Then, tap the cell phone button to place it in the new box.
map.popup_tutorial_selectbox: In the final part of the test, you will *select the three boxes* where these items were located in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_selectboxV2: In part three, place each item in its location from part one.
map.popup_tutorial_boxhint: *Hint:* One item was located in this box. Tap here.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox: Now tap on the locations of the other two items.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox2: Tap on the locations of the other two items.
map.popup_tutorial_tapbox3: Tap on the location of the final item.
map.popup_tutorial_subheader: Tap the boxes where the items were located in part one.
map.popup_tutorial_cellbox: *Hint:* The cell phone was located here. Tap this box.
map.popup_tab_home:
*This is the Home tab.* 
Check here to see if it's time to take a test.
map.popup_tab_progress:
*This is the Progress tab.* 
See where you are in the testing week.
map.popup_tab_earnings:
*This is the Earnings tab.* 
See what you've earned and how to get bonuses.
map.popup_tab_resources:
*Questions?* 
Change your availability, contact your study coordinator, and more in the Resources tab.
map.popup_nicejob:
*Nice job on the tests!* 
Let's take a look at the rest of the app.
map.low_memory_toast: Please close other apps to improve performance.
map.low_memory_restart_dialogue: Your device is not capable of running other apps at the same time as {APP_NAME}. Please close other apps before starting a test session.
map.battery_optimization_overview:
Your phone has a setting to help preserve your battery life, and it is called a “battery optimization” setting.

The {APP_NAME} app will have minimal impact on the battery life of your phone. It is recommended that you turn off the battery optimization setting for the {APP_NAME} app. Doing so will help make sure you receive test notifications on time.
map.battery_optimization_prompt: Next, there will be a pop-up asking you to turn off battery optimization by allowing the {APP_NAME} app to run in the background. Please *allow* to help ensure your notifications work correctly.
map.battery_optimization_reminder: Your notifications are experiencing a delay. Next, there will be a pop-up asking you to turn off battery optimization by allowing the {APP_NAME} app to run in the background. Please *allow* to help ensure your notifications work correctly.

map.notification_weekbefore: Reminder: Your next testing cycle starts in one week. Tap to confirm or reschedule.
map.notification_daybefore: Reminder: Your next testing cycle begins tomorrow. Tap to confirm or reschedule.

map.notification1_default: It's time for the first test of the day! This test will be available until {TIME}.
map.notification1_halfway: You're halfway through the week. Keep it up! Today's first test will be available until {TIME}.

map.notifications2_default: It's time for today's second test! This test will be available until {TIME}.

map.onboarding_body: Every six months, you will be asked to complete *one week* of cognitive tests. During the week, you will be reminded *4 times a day* to complete tests within the app. You may be in the study for as long as *5 years* (10 weeks of testing).
map.radio_commit: I commit to participate for the length of the study
map.radio_nocommit: I'm NOT able to commit to this study
map.onboarding_nocommit_body: Thank you for letting us know you are not able to commit to the study at this time. If you need any questions answered before continuing with the study, please contact the study team by clicking HELP in the upper right hand corner of the screen.
map.onboarding_nocommit_landing_body:
To participate in the ARC study, you must commit to the required testing schedule. You previously indicated that you were unable to do so.

If you'd like to participate, tap Next to review the requirements. If you'd like to leave the study, please contact your study coordinator.
map.onboarding_commit_body: Your participation in this study and every task you complete contributes to advancing Alzheimer's Disease research.
map.onboarding_notifications_body1: We use notifications to let you know it's time to take a test. *Notifications are essential for the study to function properly.* Please allow notifications for this app throughout the duration of the study.
map.onboarding_notifications_popup: *Please tap "allow"* so we can tell you when tests are available.
map.onboarding_notifications_body2_ios: You must turn on notifications for the study to function properly. Please visit the Settings App, tap Notifications, then tap DIAN and turn on the Allow Notifications switch.
map.onboarding_notifications_body2_android: You must turn on notifications for the study to function properly. Please go to Settings and make sure notifications for {APP_NAME} are turned on.
map.popup_opensettings: We'll now open your Settings. Once there, tap Notifications, and turn on the Allow Notifications Switch.

Now, we'll ask you a few questions to help us determine when to send you those notifications.

map.DIAN_Inv_about_body: The Ambulatory Research in Cognition (ARC) app was designed by the Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory (CTRLab) in the Department of Neurology at Washington University in St. Louis for participants enrolled in the Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer Network (DIAN) studies. The ARC app assesses cognition using frequently administered but brief cognitive tests. This app is intended for use only by participants enrolled in DIAN studies.
map.faq_subpage_subheader: Tap a question to see the answer.
map.faq_testing_q1: How long do I have to take tests?
map.faq_testing_q2: Do I have to take the test as soon as I get the notification?
map.faq_testing_q3: What if I miss some tests?
map.faq_testing_q4: How do I know when I have finished the test?

map.faq_testing_a1: You will get notifications for tests four times per day for one week, then no tests for the next *6* months. The individual tests take approximately 3 to 5 minutes to complete. A new week of tests will start every six months for as long as you are in the study.
map.faq_testing_a2: You will have up to two hours from the time you get the notification to take the test. After two hours, you will no longer be able to complete that test session.
map.faq_testing_a3: While we want you to complete as many tests as possible, we realize that you may lead a very busy life! It's ok to miss a few tests, but please try to complete as many as possible - they only take 3-5 minutes each. Also, when you get a notification, you have two hours to take the test; you do not have to drop everything and take the test immediately.

map.faq_earnings_q4: What's the difference between "this week" and "study total"?
map.faq_earnings_a1: You can earn up to $32 per 7-day testing cycle for as long as you are in the study. You earn $0.50 for each test you complete (up to $14 per cycle). You also can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests.
map.faq_earnings_a2: Your payment will be processed immediately upon completion of a testing cycle. It may take several business days for your payment to be processed. Please contact your study coordinator if you have any questions about when you will receive your payment.
map.faq_earnings_a3: You will be paid via an electronic gift card or check.
map.faq_earnings_a4: This week refers to the amount of money you have earned during the current testing cycle. "Study total" refers to the cumulative amount of money you have earned from all testing cycles, including the current one.
map.faq_earnings_a5: Bonus goals are money that can be earned above and beyond the $0.50 earned per completed test session. During each testing cycle, you can work toward three bonus goals: $1 per day for completing all four tests in one day (up to $7 per cycle); $6 per cycle for completing two or more tests each day; and $5 per cycle for completing 21 or more tests. You are able to earn money for all three bonus goals.
map.progress_studydisclaimer: End date depends upon your testing schedule.

You will receive a *Gift Card or check* for the earned amount after each week of testing.

map.chronotype_body1:
Answer questions in regard to your sleep and wake behavior on work and work-free days. 

^Please estimate an average of your normal sleep behavior over the past 6 weeks when you were able to follow your usual routines.^
map.chronotype_q1: I have been a shift- or night-worker in the past three months.
map.chronotype_body2:
Please answer all of the following questions even if you do not work or do not work 7 days/week. 

^Please don't forget to indicate AM or PM.^
map.chronotype_workfree_sleep: On *work-free days* when I don't use an alarm clock, I normally *fall asleep* at:
map.chronotype_workfree_wake: On *work-free days* when I don't use an alarm clock, I normally *wake up* at:
map.chronotype_disclaim1: This is NOT when you go to bed.
map.chronotype_disclaim2: This is NOT when you get out of bed.
map.wakesurvey_body: The following questions will ask you about sleep specific to last night and waking this morning.

map.wake_q2: How long did it take you to fall asleep last night?
map.wake_q3a: How many times did you wake for 5 minutes or longer?
map.wake_q4: What time did you wake up this morning?
map.wake_q5: What time did you get out of bed this morning?
map.wake_q6: How would you rate the quality of your sleep?

map.context_q3: How would you rate *your overall mood* right now?

As quickly as you can, tap the pair at the bottom of the screen that matches one of the pairs at the top.

map.grids_body: Study the grid and try to remember the location of the three items.

map.grids_vb_body: In this activity, you will study 3 items placed on a grid. Then, you will be asked to remember each item and its location on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_step1:
This test has three parts.

In the first part, you will see 3 items placed in a grid of boxes. You will be asked to *remember each item and its location on the grid*. The goal is to try and remember where each item is placed on the grid. You will have 3 seconds to study the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place:
Place each item in its location
from part one.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place_other: Great! Now, place the other two items on the grid.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_change_mind: Change your mind? Select a different item to replace, or tap *Remove Item* to clear.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech1:
*Nice work!*
It looks like you didn't need any help with placement, but we want to make sure we still teach you how to swap and remove items before you move onto the actual test.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech2: If you change your mind after placing an item, you can move it. Let's try it.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech3: Great! If you would like to clear a box with an item, first tap that box...
map.grids_tutorial_vb_select: Select the item that was here.

Your phone has a setting to help preserve your battery life, and it is called a “battery optimization” setting.

The {APP_NAME} app will have minimal impact on the battery life of your phone. It is recommended that you turn off the battery optimization setting for the {APP_NAME} app. Doing so will help make sure you receive test notifications on time.

map.onboarding_commit_body: Votre participation à cette étude ainsi que toutes les tâches que vous effectuez contribuent à l'avancement de la recherche sur la maladie d'Alzheimer.

map.DIAN_Inv_about_body: L’application Recherche ambulatoire sur la cognition (Ambulatory Research in Cognition, ARC) a été conçue par le Cognitive Technology Research Laboratory (CTRLab) du service de neurologie de l’Université Washington de Saint-Louis pour les participants inscrits aux études du Réseau de la maladie d’Alzheimer à transmission autosomique dominante (Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer Network, DIAN). L’application ARC évalue la cognition à l’aide de tests cognitifs brefs, que l’on fait passer fréquemment. Cette application est réservée à l’usage des participants inscrits aux études DIAN.
map.faq_header: Sujets de la Foire aux questions
map.faq_subpage_subheader: Appuyez sur une question pour en voir la réponse.
map.faq_testing_q1: Pendant combien de temps dois-je effectuer les tests?
map.faq_testing_q2: Dois-je effectuer le test dès que je reçois l'avis?
map.faq_testing_q3: Et si je manque quelques tests?
map.faq_testing_q4: Comment puis-je savoir quand j'ai terminé le test?
map.faq_testing_q5: Comment puis-je savoir quand les tests de la semaine suivante commencent?
map.faq_testing_q6: Que devrais-je faire si je continue de recevoir le message « Aucun test n'est disponible en ce moment »?
map.faq_testing_q7: Puis-je changer l'horaire de mes tests?
map.faq_testing_q8: Puis-je voir comment je me débrouille dans les tests?
map.faq_testing_q9: Puis-je permettre à un ami/petit-enfant/conjoint d'effectuer quelques tests?
map.faq_testing_q10: Je ne suis pas sûr de bien effectuer le test. Puis-je m'exercer?
map.faq_testing_a1: Vous recevrez des notifications pour les tests quatre fois par jour pendant une semaine. Ensuite, aucun autre test pendant les *6* prochains mois. Les tests individuels prennent à peu près 3 à 5 minutes à effectuer. Une nouvelle semaine de tests commencera tous les trois mois aussi longtemps que vous participez à l'étude.
map.faq_testing_a2: Vous aurez jusqu'à deux heures à partir du moment où vous recevez la notification pour effectuer le test. Après deux heures, vous ne pourrez plus effectuer cette session de test.
map.faq_testing_a3: Bien que nous aimerions que vous effectuiez le plus de tests possible, nous sommes conscients que vous pouvez avoir une vie très occupée! Ce n'est pas grave de manquer quelques tests, mais veuillez essayer d'en effectuer le plus possible - ils ne prennent que 3 à 5 minutes chacun. De plus, lorsque vous recevez une notification, vous avez deux heures pour effectuer le test; vous n'avez pas besoin de laisser tout tomber pour effectuer le test immédiatement.
map.faq_testing_a4: À la fin des tests, il vous sera demandé de répondre si oui ou non vous avez été interrompu(e) durant n'importe lequel des tests. Une fois que vous avez répondu à cette question, vous signerez avec vos initiales et appuierez sur « Envoyer ». Cela marquera la fin du test.
map.faq_testing_a5: Si vous n'êtes pas actuellement dans un cycle de tests, la page d'accueil de l'application indiquera les dates de votre prochaine semaine de tests. De plus, vous recevrez des notifications de rappel un mois, une semaine et un jour par chaque cycle de tests. Vous aurez l'option de modifier les dates de votre cycle de tests d'une semaine.
map.faq_testing_a6: Si vous ouvrez l'application et voyez « Il n'y a aucun test à effectuer pour le moment », il est possible que vous ayez manqué la période de 2 heures de votre session de test. Vous recevrez une notification lorsqu'il sera temps d'effectuer votre prochain test. Le test sera disponible pendant 2 heures après la notification.                                                Si vous voyez le message « Il n'y a aucun test à effectuer pour le moment » et que vous pensez qu'il s'agit d'une erreur, veuillez contacter votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude.
map.faq_testing_a7: Vous pouvez changer le moment de la journée où vous êtes disponible pour effectuer le test à tout moment. Pour changer le moment de la journée où vous êtes disponible pour les tests, sélectionnez « Ressources » à partir de la barre de navigation au bas de l'écran de l'application, puis « Changer ma disponibilité », et enfin « J'aimerais changer le *moment de la journée* où  je suis disponible pour effectuer les tests. » De plus, vous pouvez changer les dates du cycle de tests à venir lorsque vous avez terminé votre cycle de tests actuel. Pour changer votre prochain cycle de tests, sélectionnez « Ressources » à partir de la barre de navigation au bas de l'écran de l'application, puis « Changer ma disponibilité », et enfin « J'aimerais changer les *dates* de mon prochain *cycle de tests* ».
map.faq_testing_a8: Vous ne pourrez pas voir les résultats des tests. Les données recueillies durant les tests sont à des fins de recherche uniquement et ne sont pas destinées à établir un diagnostic ou à traiter une affection. Veuillez contacter votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude pour toute préoccupation.
map.faq_testing_a9: Nous vous demandons d'effectuer les tests vous-même dans le cadre de votre participation à l'étude. Après chaque test, on vous demandera de signer avec vos initiales pour confirmer que vous êtes la personne qui a effectué le test.
map.faq_testing_a10: Vous pouvez consulter les tutoriels en tout temps en guise d'« exercice » à la passation des tests. Pour ce faire, sélectionnez « Voir un tutoriel » dans l'écran d'instruction d'un test.
map.faq_tech_q1: Que dois-je faire si je change de téléphone?
map.faq_tech_q2: L'application ne fonctionne pas. Que devrais-je faire?
map.faq_tech_q4: Comment puis-je vérifier si les notifications sont configurées correctement?
map.faq_tech_q5: Comment puis-je résoudre les problèmes de vérification en deux étapes?
map.faq_tech_q6: Qu'est-ce que le Service de planificateur de tests?
map.faq_tech_q7: Pourquoi est-ce que je reçois un message me disant de fermer d'autres applications?
map.faq_tech_a1: Vous devrez réinstaller l’application si vous changez de téléphone. Veuillez communiquer avec votre coordonnateur de l’étude pour obtenir un mot de passe mis à jour pour votre nouvel appareil.
map.faq_tech_a2: Contactez votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude. Si il ou elle ne peut pas faire fonctionner l'application, il ou elle vous reviendra aussitôt que possible avec une solution.
map.faq_tech_a3: Nous recueillons vos initiales au moyen de la page de signature ainsi que les résultats de vos tests neurocognitifs. Les données seront sauvegardées sur votre téléphone jusqu'à ce qu'il y ait une connexion. Une fois qu'il y a une connexion, vos données seront transférées de manière sécuritaire directement de l'application mobile à la base de données de l'étude en utilisant le protocole SSL (Secure Sockets Layer) avec chiffrement.
map.faq_tech_a4: Vos notifications sont configurées lorsque vous déterminez votre disponibilité. Vous recevrez 4 notifications de tests par jour durant votre période de disponibilité. Vous pouvez changer cette période à l'aide de Ressources dans la barre de navigation de l'application.
map.faq_tech_a5: Si vous avez des problèmes avec la vérification en deux étapes, la première étape est de vérifier les chiffres du numéro de téléphone sur la page qui vous demande de saisir un code de vérification de session. Ces deux chiffres devraient être les mêmes que les deux derniers chiffres de votre numéro de téléphone. Si ces deux chiffres ne correspondent pas à votre numéro de téléphone, veuillez contacter votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude. Si ces deux chiffres ne correspondent pas à votre numéro de téléphone, la prochaine étape est d'envoyer un nouveau code à votre numéro de téléphone. Vous pouvez le faire en cliquant sur « Vous n'avez pas reçu le code? » sur la page qui vous demande de saisir un code de vérification de session. Si le nouveau code ne fonctionne pas (ou que vous n'avez pas reçu de code), veuillez contacter votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude.
map.faq_tech_a6: Durant les semaines de tests, vous pouvez voir une notification selon laquelle le Service de planificateur de tests est activé. Ce service nous permet de vous envoyer des notifications de tests à des moments précis. Étant donné qu'il est requis pour l'étude, il ne peut être désactivé.                                     Le Service de planificateur de tests fonctionnera seulement durant les semaines de tests et n'aura pas un effet significatif sur la durée de vie de la batterie de votre téléphone.
map.faq_tech_a7: Vous pouvez voir ce message apparaître durant une session de tests : « Veuillez fermer d'autres applications pour améliorer la performance. » Cela peut vouloir dire que votre appareil n'est pas capable de faire fonctionner d'autres applications en même temps que DIAN. Pour une performance optimale, veuillez fermer les autres applications avant de commencer une session de tests.
map.faq_earnings_q4: Quelle est la différence entre « cette semaine » et le « total de l'étude »?
map.faq_earnings_q5: Comment fonctionnent les bonus pour objectif?
map.faq_earnings_a1: Vous pouvez gagner jusqu'à 32 $ par cycle de 7 jours de tests aussi longtemps que vous participez à l'étude. Vous gagnez 0,50$ pour chaque test que vous effectuez (jusqu'à 14 $ par cycle). Vous pouvez aussi travailler pour obtenir trois bonus pour objectif : 1 $ par jour pour avoir effectué tous les quatre tests en un jour (jusqu'à 7 $ par cycle); 6 $ par cycle pour avoir effectué deux tests ou plus chaque jour; et 5 $ par cycle pour avoir effectué 21 tests ou plus.
map.faq_earnings_a2: Vos paiements seront traités immédiatement après avoir terminé le cycle de tests. Cela peut prendre plusieurs jours ouvrables pour que votre paiement soit traité. Veuillez contacter votre coordonnateur(trice) de l'étude pour toute question sur le moment où vous recevrez votre paiement.
map.faq_earnings_a3: Vous serez payé au moyen d'une carte-cadeau électronique ou un chèque.
map.faq_earnings_a4: « Cette semaine » fait référence au montant d'argent que vous avez gagné durant le cycle de tests actuel. « Total de l'étude » fait référence au montant cumulatif d'argent que vous avez gagné pour tous les cycles de tests, y compris le cycle actuel.
map.faq_earnings_a5: Les bonus pour objectif sont de l'argent qui peut être gagné en plus des 0,50 $ gagnés par session de tests terminée. Durant chaque cycle de tests, vous pouvez travailler pour gagner trois bonus pour objectif : 1 $ par jour pour avoir effectué tous les quatre tests en un jour (jusqu'à 7 $ par cycle); 6 $ par cycle pour avoir effectué deux tests ou plus chaque jour; et 5 $ par cycle pour avoir effectué 21 tests ou plus. Vous pouvez gagner de l'argent pour tous ces trois bonus pour objectif.
map.progress_timebtwtesting: Temps entre les semaines de tests :

map.chronotype_body1:
Répondez à des questions concernant vos habitudes de sommeil et de réveil pour les jours avec et sans travail.                          

^Veuillez estimer en moyenne vos habitudes de sommeil normales au cours des six dernières semaines lorsque vous avez pu suivre vos routines habituelles.^
map.chronotype_q1: J’ai été un travailleur de quarts ou de nuit au cours des trois derniers mois.
map.chronotype_q2: Normalement, je travaille ____ jours par semaine.
map.chronotype_body2:
Veuillez répondre à toutes les questions suivantes, même si vous ne travaillez pas, ou ne travaillez pas sept jours par semaine.

 ^N’oubliez pas d’indiquer AM ou PM.^
map.chronotype_workdays_sleep: Les  *jours de travail*, je *m’endors* normalement à :
map.chronotype_workdays_wake: Les *jours de travail*, je *me réveille* normalement à :
map.chronotype_workfree_sleep: Les *jours sans travail* lorsque je n’utilise pas de réveille-matin, je *m’endors* normalement à :
map.chronotype_workfree_wake: Les *jours sans travail* lorsque je n’utilise pas de réveille-matin, je *me réveille* normalement à :
map.chronotype_disclaim1: Ce N’EST PAS l’heure à laquelle vous vous couchez.
map.chronotype_disclaim2: Ce N’EST PAS l’heure à laquelle vous vous levez.
map.wakesurvey_body: Les questions suivantes porteront précisément sur votre sommeil la nuit dernière et votre réveil ce matin.
map.wake_q1: À quelle heure vous êtes-vous couché la nuit dernière?
map.wake_q2: Combien de temps vous a-t-il fallu pour vous endormir?
map.wake_q3a: Combien de fois vous êtes-vous réveillé pendant 5 minutes ou plus?
map.wake_q4: À quelle heure vous êtes-vous réveillé ce matin?
map.wake_q5: À quelle heure vous êtes-vous levé ce matin?
map.wake_q6: Comment évalueriez-vous la qualité de votre sommeil?
map.context_body: Ces questions vous demanderont d’indiquer brièvement ce qui se passe autour de vous en ce moment même.
map.context_q1: Qui est avec vous en ce moment?
map.context_q3: Comment évalueriez-vous *votre humeur générale* en ce moment?
map.context_q4: Comment évalueriez-vous *la façon dont vous vous sentez* en ce moment?
map.context_q5: Au cours des 5 dernières minutes, qu’avez-vous fait principalement?

map.testing_id_body: En apposant mes initiales sur la ligne ci-dessous, j’atteste que j’ai effectué ces tests.
map.prices_body:
Nous vous demandons de déterminer si le prix affiché représente une bonne affaire pour cet article.  

La paire ne restera pas longtemps à l’écran, prenez donc une décision rapidement et prêtez une attention particulière.
map.prices_overlay: Vous verrez maintenant un article et deux prix. Veuillez sélectionner le prix qui correspond à l'article de la section précédente.
map.symbols_body:
Vous verrez trois paires de symboles en haut de l’écran et deux paires en bas. 

Aussi rapidement que possible, appuyez sur la paire située au bas de l’écran qui correspond à une des paires du haut.
map.symbols_match: Quelle paire ci-dessous correspond à une des paires ci-dessus?
map.grids_body: Étudiez la grille et essayez de vous souvenir de l’emplacement des trois items.
map.grids_overlay1: Essayez de vous souvenir de l’emplacement des items!
map.grids_overlay3: Ensuite : Appuyez sur l’emplacement des items
map.grids_subheader_boxes: Appuyez sur les boîtes où les items étaient situés dans la partie un.
map.grids_vb_body: Dans cette activité, vous allez étudier 3 items placés dans une grille. Ensuite, on vous demandera de vous souvenir de chaque item et de son emplacement dans la grille.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_step1:
Ce test comprend trois parties.

Dans la première partie, vous verrez 3 items placés dans une grille contenant des boîtes. On vous demandera de vous *souvenir de chaque item et de son emplacement dans la grille*. Le but est d’essayer de vous souvenir de l’emplacement de chaque item dans la grille. Vous aurez 3 secondes pour étudier la grille.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place:
Placez chaque item là où il était placé
dans la première partie.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_place_other: Excellent! Maintenant, placez les deux autres items dans la grille.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_change_mind: Vous changez d’idée? Sélectionnez un item différent pour le remplacer, ou touchez *Retirer l’item* pour effacer.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech1:
*Beau travail!*
Vous ne semblez pas avoir besoin d’aide pour placer les items, mais nous voulons nous assurer que nous vous avons bien montré comment échanger et retirer les items avant de passer au test proprement dit.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech2: Si vous changez d’idée après avoir placé un item, vous pouvez le déplacer. Essayons ensemble.
map.grids_tutorial_vb_mech3: Excellent! Si vous voulez effacer le contenu d’une boîte, touchez d’abord la boîte…

map.battery_optimization_overview:
Votre téléphone a un paramètre pour aider à préserver la durée de vie de votre batterie, et il est appelé un paramètre «d'optimisation de la batterie».

L'application {APP_NAME} aura un impact minimal sur la durée de vie de la batterie de votre téléphone. Il est recommandé de désactiver le paramètre d'optimisation de la batterie pour l'application {APP_NAME}. Cela vous aidera à vous assurer de recevoir les notifications de test à temps.
map.battery_optimization_prompt: Ensuite, une fenêtre vous demandera de désactiver l'optimisation de la batterie en permettant à l'application {APP_NAME} de s'exécuter en arrière-plan. Veuillez * autoriser * pour vous assurer que vos notifications fonctionnent correctement.
map.battery_optimization_reminder: Vos notifications sont retardées. Veuillez * autoriser * pour vous assurer que vos notifications fonctionnent correctement.

map.onboarding_body: Cada 6 meses, se le pedirá que complete *una semana* de pruebas cognitivas. Durante la semana, se le recordará *4 veces al día* que debe completar las pruebas en la aplicación. Es posible que permanezca en el estudio hasta *5 años* (10 semanas de pruebas).
